column5: Got all my kitchen chores done by noon, and I'm scratchin my noggin wondering what to do??? Despite it being wet and raw out, the daughter and I headed out to a small creekmouth for some fall crappie. Spot #1 was a bust. No current and no minnows.  20 minute drive down the road to spot #2 fishing from a bridge. No crappie, but lots of slab gills to be had. We got in a good 3 hours chasing bluegills and perch until the raw damp got the better of us.  Guess what's on the menu tomorrow night?????
Hahahah nice!!!!  Glad ya got on em!
Good job ! No way I'd have gone fishing yesterday.
Sounds like a great time.  Next time, could you please take pictures so I can look at the background and figure out where you catch crappies??   lol
What ever it is you need a hot meal!

Sounds like a great time.  Next time, could you please take pictures so I can look at the background and figure out where you catch crappies??   lol I would if I weren't having so many problems with photobucket.
Nice one Bruce, like they say, "the fish are already wet, so they don't care!"
Sounds like a nice feed Bruce.
right on Bruce. cant imagine a better way to spend a raw fall day.
I was out all day yesterday looking for redds.  Terrible terrible day.  Had I had the option, I would NOT fish.  Hats off to yuh, you're hardcore !!!
Gill are just a delicious Bruce! Nice day out with the kiddo!
Give me Gills any day, much firmer flesh on them there Gilligans,
